entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

entries.name: First to Arrive I
entries: You gain one feat of your choice.

entries.name: First to Arrive II
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ork reach adulthood at age 12 and live up to 90 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Orcs are usually over 6 feet tall and weigh between 230 and 280 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, you can move up to your movement speed toward a hostile creature you can see or hear. You must end this move closer to the enemy than you started.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You are trained in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Savage Dissonance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, before you fall unconscious, you can use your reaction to make one melee attack against a creature within melee range. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dhampirs mature at the same rate as humans, but can live for centuries.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dhampirs are the same size and build as humans. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Vampiric Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against diseases and being {@condition Charmed}.

entries.name: Undead Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Fangs
entries: You have fangs like a vampire. They are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Blood Drinker
entries: As an action, you can make a special attack with your fangs. If the attack hits, you deal necrotic damage instead of piercing damage, and you heal hit points (minimum of 1) equal to your Constitution modifier, and you can’t use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and another language of your choice.

entries.name: Kin of Mine
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills.

entries.name: Misty Escape
entries: As a reaction to taking damage, you can create a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on you. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for one minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your heritage, you have first-rate vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Unncanny Climber
entries: You have advantage on any {@skill Athletics} check made to climb difficult surfaces.

entries.name: Dark Hopsitality
entries: You have proficiency in one of the following skills: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Persuasion}.

entries.name: Vampiric Charm
entries: You can cast {@spell charm person} with this trait, using Charisma as your spellcasting ability for it. Once you cast it, you can’t cast it again with this trait until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your heritage, you have first-rate vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Vermin Speech
entries: You can cast {@spell animal friendship} an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can target only bats, rats, and wolves with it. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries: If you aren't in sunlight, you can use your action to cast polymorph on yourself to transform into a bat, rat, or wolf. When cast in this way, polymorph requires no components and cannot be dispelled. It has the following changes:

• Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the beast, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the creature’s bonus instead of yours.

• You retain the benefit of any features from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so. However, you can’t use any of your special senses, such as darkvision, unless your new form also has that sense.
Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Age
entries: With the proper replacement parts and activities to occupy yourself, you can conceivably exist indefinitely. Frames are known to degrade and lose their sanity, however, if they live too long without an explicit purpose. It is not known if this insanity visits all Frames at old age, or just those whose resolve wavers.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition Poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don't need to sleep and don't suffer the effects of {@condition Exhaustion} due to lack of rest, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours of it in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Integrated Protection
entries: Your body has built-in defensive layers, which can be enhanced with armor:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

You can don only armor with which you have proficiency. To don armor, you must incorporate it into your body over the course of 1 hour, during which you remain in contact with the armor. To doff armor, you must spend 1 hour removing it. You can rest while donning or doffing armor in this way.
While you live, your armor can't be removed from your body against your will.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain one skill proficiency of your choice, one {@book tool|phb|5|tools} proficiency of your choice, and fluency in one language of your choice.

entries.name: Integrated Tool
entries: Choose one tool you're proficient with. This tool is integrated into your body, and you double your proficiency bonus for any ability checks you make with it. You must have your hands free to use this integrated tool.

entries.name: Iron Fists
entries: When you hit with an unarmed strike, you can deal {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage, instead of the normal damage for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Swift
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet.

entries.name: Light Step
entries: When you are traveling alone for an extended period of time (one hour or more), you can move stealthily at a normal pace. (See chapter 8 of the Player's Handbook for information about travel pace.)

entries.name: Age
entries: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The English word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.
{@note If you meditate during a long rest, you finish the rest after only 4 hours. You otherwise obey all the rules for a long rest; only the duration is changed.}

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the depths of the Underdark, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Underground Magic
entries: You know the {@spell dancing lights} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire} spell once per day; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness} spell once per day; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Underground Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with {@item rapier|phb|rapiers}, {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords}, and {@item hand crossbow|phb|hand crossbows}.

subraces.name: Eladrin
entries: {@i Choose your eladrin's season: autumn, winter, spring, or summer. When finishing a long rest, any eladrin can change their season. See the "Info" tab for more information.}

entries.name: Fey Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
When you reach 3rd level, your Fey Step gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier:

items.name: Autumn
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

items.name: Winter
items.entry: When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Spring
items.entry: When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

items.name: Summer
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choosing.

entries.name: Cunning Intuition
entries: When you make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) or Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Shape Shadows
entries: You know the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility} spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Spells of the Mark
entries: If you have the Spellcasting or the Pact Magic class feature, the spells on the Mark of Shadow Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class.

entries.name: Incisive Sense
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) and Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks.

entries.name: Blessing of the Moon Weaver
entries: You know the {@spell light} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell sleep} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility} spell (targeting yourself only) once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Casting these spells with this trait doesn't require material components. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Sea Elf Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item spear|phb}, {@item trident|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb}, and {@item net|phb}.

entries.name: Child of the Sea
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Friend of the Sea
entries: Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with any beast that has an innate swimming speed.

entries.name: Necrotic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Blessing of the Raven Queen
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb}, and {@item longbow|phb}.

entries.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Age
entries: Avem grow up very fast, and live very long lives. Avem reach adulthood at age 13. On average, they live about 300 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Avem are between 2 to 3 feet tall and average about 30 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Picking Claws
entries: Avem don't have hands, but their claws are dextrous enough to handle small complex tasks. Avem can pick up weapons but can't use them in combat.

entries.name: Flight
entries: As part of a move action, an Avem can instead fly 40 feet, but must end their movement on the ground or a solid surface. An Avem who ends its turn in the air immediately plummets to the ground. To use this speed you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

entries.name: Song & Dance
entries: You have proficiency with your claws, which are a finesse weapon dealing {@dice 1d8} slashing damage.

entries.name: Dazzling Plummage
entries: As a bonus action you can double your proficiency bonus on any Charisma skill check. After using this ability you can't use it again until after a short rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Trolls tend to age slightly slower than humans, reaching adulthood around 20 years of age and living up to 150 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Trolls stand at between 6 to 7 feet tall, and are often considered bulky compared to the common races. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Scaly Hide
entries: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Warmother's Cry
entries: You unleash a surge of power, charging forward at the heed of your own warcry. As a bonus action, you can reroll your initiative, updating it at the end of your current turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Warrior's Pride
entries: You have proficiency with simple and martial weapons.

entries.name: Gaping Jaw
entries: In battle, you can unfurl your massive jaw and snap down on your enemies. As a bonus action, you can make a special attack with your bite. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: With the proper replacement parts and activities to occupy yourself, you can conceivably exist indefinitely. Androids are known to degrade and lose their sanity, however, if they live too long without an explicit purpose. It is not known if this insanity visits all Androids at old age, or just those whose resolve wavers.

entries.name: Size
entries: An android's size size varies greatly depending on its specific function. There are androids that stand at just about 5 feet, while some that are built stand well over 7 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Lightfoot
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Obscuring Gaze
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Innocent Charm
entries: Your endearing naivete has the ability to win over even the hardest-strung mercenaries. You have advantage on Charisma checks made to befriend a non-hostile creature.

entries.name: Energy Weapon
entries: You can use your bonus action to construct a beam of destructive energy centered around your weapon. On your next successful melee weapon attack, target creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes an additional {@dice 2d6} radiant damage and is {@condition Poisoned} until the end of your next turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Age
entries: With the proper replacement parts and activities to occupy yourself, you can conceivably exist indefinitely. Vect are known to degrade and lose their sanity, however, if they live too long without an explicit purpose. It is not known if this insanity visits all Vect at old age, or just those whose resolve wavers.

entries.name: Size
entries: As constructs modified by self-aware machines, Vect could conceivably be perfectly uniform, like the Frames that preceded them. However, the Foundries are either inherently flawed, or otherwise have a fondness for making diverse units, for each created Vect is in some way unique. Vect units stand between 5 and 7 feet tall and average about 150 to 300 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Constructed by the Foundary
entries: Even though you were constructed, you are a living creature, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition Poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

Instead of sleeping, you enter an inactive state for 4 hours each day. You do not dream in this state; you are fully aware of your surroundings and notice approaching enemies and other events as normal.
You can still be placed into a torpor by sleep-inducing magic.

entries.name: Thermal Vision
entries: Equipped with a heat-detecting thermal vision system beneath your eyelids, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades reprentative of thermal vision.

entries.name: Mind Over Matter
entries: Your mechanical mind is inherently logical, and is not easily swayed. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition Charmed}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Made to Assemble
entries: You gain one skill proficiency of your choice and one {@book tool|phb|5|tools} proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: On the Line
entries: You know the {@spell mending} cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: It's Just Anti-Freeze
entries: You have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Autonomous Blaster Device
entries: You can cast the {@spell magic missile} spell as a 2nd-level spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: From the Oceans
entries: You gain a swimming speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Neural Synapses
entries: Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts that have an inborn swimming speed.

entries.name: Age
entries: Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. They live to be around 80.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dragonborn are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in the table.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines the size, shape, and damage type of the exhalation.

When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature takes {@dice 2d6} damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to {@dice 3d6} at 6th level, {@dice 4d6} at 11th level, and {@dice 5d6} at 16th level.
After you use your breath weapon, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Combat Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, and {@item warhammer|phb}.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item Smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Stonecunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the {@skill History} skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Dwarven Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Dwarven Armor Training
entries: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

entries.name: Age
entries: Birdfolk tend to grow up very fast, reaching adulthood at the age of 14 and living up to 70 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Birdfolk are about 5 feet tall. They have thin, lightweight bodies that weigh between 80 and 100 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Aerial Vault
entries: You gain a flying speed of 40 feet while you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor. You fall if you end your turn in the air.

entries.name: Peak Dwellers
entries: You're acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet. You're also naturally adapted to strong wind and cold environments, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

entries.name: Intimidating Plummage
entries: As a bonus action you can double your proficiency bonus on any {@skill Intimidation} skill check. After using this ability, you can't use it again until after a short or long rest.

entries.name: Talons
entries: You are proficient with your unarmed strikes, which deal {@dice 1d6} slashing damage on a hit.

entries.name: Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write English and one other language of your choice.
